articles.title: Attorney says detained Korean Hyundai workers had special skills for short-term jobs - PBS
articles.description: An immigration attorney says many South Korean workers detained in a U.S. immigration raid at a Hyundai plant in Georgia were brought in for highly specialized work that Americans aren't trained to perform.
articles.content: SAVANNAH, Ga. (AP) A lawyer for several workers detained at a Hyundai factory in Georgia says many of the South Koreans rounded up in the immigration raid are engineers and equipment installers broug… [+6974 chars]

articles.author: Patrick Pester
articles.title: 'Blood moon' gallery: Stunning snaps from last night's total lunar eclipse - Live Science
articles.description: A "blood moon" hovered above parts of the globe last night. And while North America missed out, we've rounded up some of the best photographs of September 2025's total lunar eclipse.
articles.content: A lunar eclipse can give the moon a red hue, which is why it's called a "blood moon." Here it is photographed with double exposure above Jiujiang, China. (Image credit: Photo by Shen Junfeng/VCG via … [+3316 chars]

articles.author: Sara  Moniuszko
articles.title: Chagas disease, or deadly "kissing bug" disease, has spread in the U.S. Here's what to know. - CBS News
articles.description: Chagas disease​ is already endemic to 21 countries in the Americas, and growing evidence of the parasite is challenging the non-endemic label in the U.S., the CDC says.
articles.content: Chagas disease, a potentially deadly condition caused by an infected triatomine insect or "kissing bug," may be becoming endemic in the United States, according to a Centers for Disease Control and P… [+4282 chars]
